intro: Ouratea cassinifolia, commonly known as the white-flowered ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, often glossy leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory tree or shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. The botanical features of Ouratea cassinifolia make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its natural habitat.
